meanings.definition: To convert analog information into digital form.
meanings.sent1: She digitiseses old photographs to store them on her computer.
meanings.sent2: The scanner digitiseses documents for easy access.
meanings.sent3: He tried to digitiseses his messy room into a neat virtual space.
meanings.sent4: Her memory digitiseses every detail of the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist digitiseses the colors of nature in his digital paintings.

meanings.definition: To represent data in numerical form.
meanings.sent1: The sensor digitiseses temperature readings for analysis.
meanings.sent2: The software digitiseses financial records for accurate calculations.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to digitiseses his emotions into a chart.
meanings.sent4: His mind digitiseses the chaos of thoughts into orderly lists.
meanings.sent5: The clock digitiseses time into precise numbers for display.

meanings.definition: To scan or input information into a computer system.
meanings.sent1: She digitiseses important documents for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The clerk digitiseses customer details into the database.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to digitiseses its paw prints on the touchpad.
meanings.sent4: His voice digitiseses into data as he speaks into the microphone.
meanings.sent5: The scientist digitiseses research findings for future reference.
